did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Jane Morley was a Trinity College of Arts and Sciences undergraduate at Duke University from 1972-1976. She graduated with an A. B. degree in 1976.
The material, her notes and papers from coursework, covers four subjects: Upton Sinclair, Brenda Frazier, household workers and the Duke Vigil and ranges in date from 1974-1975.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jane Morley Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Jane Morley Papers were received by the University Archives as a gift in 1976.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession A76-107 is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.p: Jane Morley was a Trinity College of Arts and Sciences undergraduate at Duke University from 1972-1976. She graduated with an A. B. degree in 1976.

scopecontent.p: Contains materials from Jane Morley's undergraduate years. Included are her research notes and manuscripts written in relation to course work at Duke. The material covers four subjects: Upton Sinclair, Brenda Frazier, household workers and the Duke Vigil and ranges in date from 1974-1975.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
